message:
SYSTEM: Ontologies-Methodology.pdf: Página 19
19
Ontology Requirements Specification
Ontology Requirements Specification is a collection of 
requirements that the ontology should fulfill, e.g. reasons to 
build the ontology, target group, intended uses. 
Requirements are those needs that the ontology to be built should 
represent/cover. 
Competency Questions (CQs) are questions that the ontology to be built 
should be able to answer.

CQs are a way to represent requirements.

CQs can be written in natural language (NL) and can be 
formalized in ontology query languages (e.g. SPARQL).
speaker: SYSTEM
